text: Crown Trunk Root Funk is an album by American jazz saxophonist Rob Brown recorded in 2007 and released on the AUM Fidelity label. He leads the Rob Brown Ensemble, which includes pianist Craig Taborn, bassist William Parker and drummer Gerald Cleaver.Crown Trunk Root Funk at AUM Fidelity The group was initially formed for a performance at the 2006 Vision Festival.Original Liner Notes by Rob Brown ==Reception== The All About Jazz review by Troy Collins states "A formidable blend of funky abstraction, angular post-bop and dark impressionism, it offers an expansive view of Brown's adventurous aesthetic."Collins, Troy. Crown Trunk Root Funk review at All About Jazz In a review for PopMatters Gabriel Baker says "Generally well-balanced, eminently exploratory, and surprisingly funky, Crown Trunk Root Funk is a successful product from a musician just as adept in the studio as he is on a New York club stage or at any other venue."Baker, Gabriel. Crown Trunk Root Funk review at PopMatters ==Track listing== :All compositions by Rob Brown # "Rocking Horse" – 10:55 # "Clearly Speaking" – 6:54 # "Sonic Ecosystem" – 11:15 # "Ghost Dog" – 7:31 # "Exuberance" – 6:16 # "Lifeboat" – 6:27 # "Worlds Spinning" – 9:51 ==Personnel== *Rob Brown – alto sax *Craig Taborn - piano, electronics *William Parker - bass *Gerald Cleaver – drums ==References== Category:2008 albums Category:Rob Brown (saxophonist) albums Category:AUM Fidelity albums
title: Crown Trunk Root Funk
